      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected Collections(Application parent)
      An Application/Account only has one set of Collections, therefore this object is always created as a result of parsing returning json upon connection.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Collections

        protected Collections(Application parent)
        An Application/Account only has one set of Collections, therefore this object is always created as a result of parsing returning json upon connection. Therefore this method is protected.
        Parameters:
        parent -

    • Method Detail

      • parseJson

        public static Collections parseJson(Application parent,
                    java.lang.String json)
        Parses a String of json text and returns a Collections object. It will correctly parse the Collections object if it is toplevel, or also if nested in an 'array' key-value pair.
        Parameters:
        parent - the Application object associated with the json
        json - the String with the json text
        Returns:
        an Collections object, or null if the parsing failed

      • parseJsonObject

        public static Collections parseJsonObject(Application parent,
                          org.json.simple.JSONObject jsonObj)
        Unmarshalls an Collections object from a JSONObject. This method assumes the name-values are immediately attached to the passed object and not nested under a key (e.g. 'array')
        Parameters:
        parent - the Collections object associated with the json
        jsonObj - the JSONObject
        Returns:
        an Collections object, or null if the unpacking failed

      • getUrl

        public java.lang.String getUrl()
        Gets the hypermedia url associated with this collection.
        Returns:
        the String url, which should always exist

      • findCollection

        public Collection findCollection(java.lang.String name)
        A convenience method for finding a child Collection by name for this Application/Account
        Parameters:
        name - the String name of the collection as given in the SR UI
        Returns:
        the Collection object, or null if not found
